author: Paulo Trevisani
title: Brazil’s Temer Vows to End Strike and Continue Economic Overhauls
text:
SÃO PAULO—Brazil’s President Michel Temer pledged on Tuesday to end a disruptive truckers strike and press on with his efforts to overhaul Latin America’s largest economy.
Mr. Temer on Sunday agreed to tax cuts for diesel fuel and other benefits for truckers with a cost to taxpayers of close to $3 billion through the end of this year, after a week of highway blockades that have slowed or halted shipments of food, fuel, medicine and other goods.
...
